title: Calories in Brisket
meta_description: Discover calories in brisket per 100g, including protein, fat, carbs, and full nutrition breakdown with tweaks and FAQs for better meal planning.
assumptions: Cooked beef brisket, whole cut with some fat trimmed, braised or roasted, no added sauces or seasonings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by cut, fat content, cooking method, and portion size. Check labels or sources for exact values.

quick_answer.text: 100g of cooked brisket provides about 250 kcal and 25g protein.

label_note: Values mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaging.

faqs.q: How many calories in 100g of brisket?
faqs.a: Approximately 250 kcal for cooked beef brisket with moderate fat.
Yes, about 25g protein per 100g, making it a good source for muscle building.

faqs.q: What's the fat content in brisket?
faqs.a: Around 16g total fat per 100g, including 6g saturated fat.

faqs.q: Does cooking method affect calories in brisket?
faqs.a: Yes, braising retains more fat than grilling lean cuts; opt for trimming to reduce calories.
No carbs, fiber, or sugars in plain cooked brisketâ€”it's mostly protein and fat.
